bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Artist, architect, and educator specializing in sustainable design and historic preservation. Graduate of the College of William and Mary (B.F.A. Painting and Sculpture) and University of Pennsylvania (M.Arch). She has taught architectural courses for Colorado State Unieristy and Mt. Vernon College. In addition to owning her own firm (StudioEESTI Architecture), Kiisk has served as the Architect for the Wyoming State Historic Preservation Office since 2016. She was the founding director of the Institute for the Built Environment and previously served on the National Architectural Accrediting Board.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection includes student projects and course notes, business records, manuscript drafts and published articls, reference files, office recorsd, architectural drawings, design sketches, and correspondence throughout Kiisk's career.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged according to original order with guidance from Shepherd and Lowel''s "Standard Series and Subseries for ARchitecture and Landscape Design."
